pageTitle: Prime Minister Trudeau meets with European Council President Donald Tusk and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau met today with President Donald Tusk of the European Council and President Jean-Claude Juncker of the European Commission on the margins of the 21st session of the Conference of the Parties (COP21).

The leaders reaffirmed the importance of the Canada-European Union (EU) relationship recognizing that the EU is Canadaâ€™s second largest trade and investment partner, and a central actor on the vast majority of global issues of concern to Canada.

The leaders discussed climate change, Canada's commitment to bringing 25, 000 refugees to Canada, as well as the anti-ISIL Coalition.

They acknowledged that the Canada-EU Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement and the Strategic Partnership Agreement, once ratified and implemented, will deepen and broaden the scope of our bilateral cooperation on a wide range of issues.
